summary: I HAVE A 1998 TOYOTA SIENNA LE.  ALL OF THE SEAT BELTS DO NOT RETRACT BACK INTO THE PANELS WITHOUT HELP FROM THE PASSENGERS.  IF YOU LEAN FORWARD THEY STAY WHERE THEY ARE EXTENDED TO.  I HAVE HAD THEM LOOKED AT AND THE TECHNICIAN SAID THE RETURN SPRINGS HAVE ALL RELAXED.  THIS IS THE 4TH TOYOTA AUTOMOBILE I HAVE OWNED AND ALL OF THEM HAVE DONE THIS.  I DON'T KNOW HOW THIS CAN BE SAFE? *TR
